results.title: The Lombards at the first Crusade = I Lombardi alla prima Crociata
results.creator_credit: Brian Large, Gabriele Lavia, National Video Corporation and Radiotelevisione Italiana
results.brief_description: Giuseppe Verdi’s “I Lombardi” with libretto by Temistocle Solera, was first performed at La Scala in 1843. This made for television production, also performed at Teatro alla Scala in Milan, features the Orchestra and Chorus of La Scala conducted by Gianandrea Gavazzeni and a wonderful cast of lead singers including Jose Carreras (Oronte), Ghena Dimitrova (Giselda), Silvano Carroli (Pagano) and Carlo Bini (Arvino). The story takes place during the time of the first Crusade in 1099 A.D. in the settings of Milan, Antioch and the country near Jerusalem. Giovanni Agostinucci’s stage sets are many and varied, adding depth and substance to the production of this medieval story of Crusaders, knights and soldiers, and damsels in distress. A spectacular presentation visually, excellent support cast and an outstanding solo violin performance by Franco Fantini. Sung in Italian with no subtitles. Booklet included.

results.title: The Local handyman
results.brief_description: The life of a typical English blacksmith showing the great variety of jobs that he is called upon to undertake. The film stresses the blacksmith’s modern methods, adapted to today’s needs, and his traditional craftsman’s attitude to his work.

results.title: The Lizard [musical accompaniment]
results.brief_description: Gentle observations of lizards engulfing beetles, watching, darting among the leaves and twigs of where they live, and laying eggs.

results.title: The Living soil
results.creator_credit: Roger Seccombe, Nicholas Alexander and CSIRO
results.brief_description: Without spoken commentary, this film depicts both the life of the soil and the life within it. The film also demonstrates through photography, the chemical cycle of soil. For many people soil is just dirt. Yet through the fresh eye of the camera, soil is seen as the home of a vital community.

results.title: The Living reef (Captioned)
results.brief_description: A program that gives a general description of the Great Barrier Reef, how it developed and the diversity of life found above and below water. It depicts the interdependence of the many different species of animal life inhabiting the Reef.

results.title: The Living reef
results.creator_credit: Ken J. Widdowson and Film Victoria
results.brief_description: The longest and largest reef in the world lies off the North-East Coast of Australia. The Great Barrier Reef extends from New Guinea to central Queensland.

results.title: The Living laboratory
results.creator_credit: Raymond Hancock and Department of Information, Government of South Africa
results.brief_description: A survey of South Africa’s varied scientific progress. It is an area which has stimulated pioneering scientists in the widening fields of archaeology and anthropology. A vast spectrum of ancient and modern life and living patterns provides sociologists, ecologists, veterinary and medical scientists with research material.

results.title: The Living goddess
results.creator_credit: Frank Heimans, Josette Heimans, Australian Film Commission and Cinetel Productions
results.brief_description: Kumari, a virgin girl-child is installed as a deity in Nepal, and wields more power among her people than almost any other living person. Shows ceremonial and religious pageant of her accession in Nepal. Written and narrated by Paul Ricketts.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Frank Heimans, Josette Heimans, Australian Film Commission and Cinetel Productions

results.title: The Living gallery
results.brief_description: Recreation for children and adults is a problem for every community. The Art Gallery of Toronto provides many activities in addition to the usual tours and conducted parties. For children there are classes in art, hobby work, story-telling and other creative projects. Art becomes more than gazing at pictures.
